subject: Sleep
title: What Is Narcolepsy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: What Is Narcolepsy.

hook.text: A student falls asleep mid-sentence during class. Not from boredom. Her brain simply switched off without warning.

buildup.text: Narcolepsy causes overwhelming daytime sleepiness and sudden, uncontrollable sleep attacks.

discovery.text: It's caused by the loss of neurons that produce hypocretin, a chemical that stabilizes wakefulness.

twist.text: Without hypocretin, the boundary between sleep and wake becomes unstable. REM intrudes into waking life.

climax.text: Narcolepsy affects about 1 in 2,000 people but takes an average of 10 years to be correctly diagnosed.

punchline.text: Narcolepsy isn't sleepiness. It's a broken wake switch.
